Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils

Enum UpdateThreadType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<UpdateThreadType>
      • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils.UpdateThreadType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<UpdateThreadType>
    public enum UpdateThreadType
extends java.lang.Enum<UpdateThreadType>
    Enumeration used to strictly type the different options for SweetBlue's update logic.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant Description
      HANDLER_THREAD
      Similar to THREAD, only that this uses a HandlerThread, rather than a regular Java thread.
      MAIN
      Run SweetBlue's update logic on the main thread.
      THREAD
      This option creates a new thread for all of SweetBlue's update logic.
      USER_CUSTOM
      If you wish to have SweetBlue run it's logic on a thread you've already created, you must use this option.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static UpdateThreadType valueOf​(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
      static UpdateThreadType[] values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Enum

        clone, compareTo, equals, finalize, getDeclaringClass, hashCode, name, ordinal, toString, valueOf

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • THREAD

        public static final UpdateThreadType THREAD
        This option creates a new thread for all of SweetBlue's update logic. Only 1 thread is created and used. This is the default behavior.

      • MAIN

        public static final UpdateThreadType MAIN
        Run SweetBlue's update logic on the main thread. This is still here as a legacy option, and/or as a last resort should you run into issues running SweetBlue on a background thread. So far, it's been unfounded that ble operations have to run on the main thread.

      • USER_CUSTOM

        public static final UpdateThreadType USER_CUSTOM
        If you wish to have SweetBlue run it's logic on a thread you've already created, you must use this option. You'll also have to sub-class ThreadHandler, and pass in your thread instance in the constructor.

      • HANDLER_THREAD

        public static final UpdateThreadType HANDLER_THREAD
        Similar to THREAD, only that this uses a HandlerThread, rather than a regular Java thread.

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static UpdateThreadType[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (UpdateThreadType c : UpdateThreadType.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared
